content:
The chemical formula for cysteine-S-dioxide is C3H7NO3S. This represents the structure of the molecule, which consists of a carbon atom, three hydrogen atoms, one nitrogen atom, three oxygen atoms, and one sulfur atom. The sulfur atom is bound to a sulfur dioxide group, which consists of a sulfur atom bonded to two oxygen atoms. The chemical structure of cysteine-S-dioxide can be represented by the following structural formula:

H2N-C-CH2-SH-SO2H

This structural formula shows the atoms in the molecule and the bonds between them. The sulfur atom is bonded to the carbon atom of the cysteine side chain, and the sulfur dioxide group is bonded to the sulfur atom. The nitrogen atom is bonded to the carbon atom, and the carbon atom is bonded to two hydrogen atoms and a second sulfur atom, which is bonded to two more hydrogen atoms. The oxygen atoms in the sulfur dioxide group are bonded to the sulfur atom.
